Summary Professor and Associate Chair: Joint Department of Biomedical Engineering at University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill and North Carolina State University 
 
Professor: Materials Science and Engineering Department at North Carolina State University 
 
Adjunct Professor: Orthopaedics (UNC-Chapel Hill), Physiology (NC State), Biotechnology (NC State), and Fiber & Polymer Science (NC State). . 
 
Founding Director: Cell Mechanics Laboratory http://cmlnew.bme.unc.edu/ 
 
Tissue Engineering and Regenerative Medicine: Expertise in biomimetic material (3D cell culture, novel biomaterials and nanomaterials) and extracellular physical stimuli (physiologic tensile strain, fluid shear, compression, hydrostatic pressure, electric field, etc) to control stem cell fate. Focus on regeneration of musculoskeletal tissues using human adipose derived stem cells. 
 
Wound Healing: Development of "smart" bandages with controlled release antimicrobial and anti-inflammatory properties to promote wound healing and tissue regeneration while killing and inhibiting growth of bacteria, with emphasis on multi-drug resistant bacteria. Summary Professor and the Director of the Nano- and Micro-Mechanical Behavior Laboratory at Lehigh University, with research specialities in the processing and mechanical properties of thin films and small-scale structures. Specific interests include fabrication and application of MEMS devices for mechanical measurements, strengthening mechanisms in platinum, gold, and aluminum thin films, viscoelasticity and stress relaxation mechanisms in metal films, wear-resistant metal films, cryogenic behavior of thin films, and nanopatterning of metal films for solid state conversion to form single crystal oxides. The mechanical behavior of small volumes of natural materials, including human skin, are also active areas of interest. Teaching expertise includes thermodynamics, mechanical behavior, and making golf putters and golf balls from scratch. Specialties:Thin film mechanical behavior, thin film deposition, mechanical testing at small scales (nanometer to micrometer), MEMS materials and devices. Summary Education research specialist with over fifteen years of international and domestic experience in education research and program evaluation. Strong analytical and communication skills oriented to program improvement, relating findings to diverse audiences, and improving education access for underserved groups. 
 
Specialties: •	Research design including the identification of stakeholders and performance indicators, instrument development, and data collection. 
•	Quantitative and qualitative data analysis and interpretation, including interviews and focus groups, survey design and implementation, and statistical analysis. 
•	Program and research team management and the coordination of research activities to meet program operation and improvement goals and the needs of multiple stakeholders.
